channel.title: Hands up who REALLY wants the Cremator to appear in EP3.
channel.description:
*Two hands up*
*Faps with other hand*
[b]Disregard this post by myself, I no longer want to see the Cremator in EP3 but I do want to see your opinions on the matter.[/b]

item.title: Hands up who REALLY wants the Cremator to appear in EP3.
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
Thank you.

Also, Alyx didn’t die in the plane crash, but she was hurt rather badly.

Read full topic
item.source: Hands up who REALLY wants the Cremator to appear in EP3.

item.title: Hands up who REALLY wants the Cremator to appear in EP3.
item.dc:creator: Sgt_Nix
item.description:
PoliceKING:

I have had a change of taught, after seeing the comments for this thread I no longer want to see the Cremator return, but I do want to see something new and , as some people already suggested, darker enemy. Possibly a Super Elite Soldier. :freeman:

Shephard.

Minus the ‘Super Elite’. Because, if he were the enemy, then VALVe can make another game (like OF) where you take control of Shephard. Which, because you are a human, will make the Shephard in the main game seem like a Super Elite Soldier… because it isnt mindless code working the guy (technically).

This makes sense in my head… so… lets pretend we’re all there for now.

intoooblivion and dias… i have to say… its been a while since a forum has made me cry from laughter.

Read full topic
item.source: Hands up who REALLY wants the Cremator to appear in EP3.

item.title: Hands up who REALLY wants the Cremator to appear in EP3.
item.dc:creator: intooblivion
item.description:
JeffMOD:

This may be another iteration of the story than the one you’re talking about, but I’m pretty sure that Alyx was supposed to die in a plane crash.

And how could a head in a jar brutally murder someone? :fffuuu:

Well in the one I was talking about it was the motivation for you to kill breen. shrugs

Anyway the e3 demos are in the leak too, but it makes you realize that they’re very scripted.

Figures.

Read full topic

The beta is so fucking awsome…reguardless of the drawn out speech.

item.source: Hands up who REALLY wants the Cremator to appear in EP3.

item.title: Hands up who REALLY wants the Cremator to appear in EP3.
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
intooblivion:

Breen found his way to immortality by being a head in a jar, Alyx was brutally murdered by Breen towards the end of the game, the wastelands were filled with xenian creatures and portal storms, resistance was mopped up and the bodies were basically deleted, and the stalkers were set loose on the city with their scythe like arms and laser eyes.

This may be another iteration of the story than the one you’re talking about, but I’m pretty sure that Alyx was supposed to die in a plane crash.

And how could a head in a jar brutally murder someone? :fffuuu:

Read full topic
item.source: Hands up who REALLY wants the Cremator to appear in EP3.

item.title: Hands up who REALLY wants the Cremator to appear in EP3.
item.dc:creator: Teh_Casino
item.description:
Dias:

Ok, I overlooked the part where Kleiner dies. But that doesn’t make it a good idea. When you introduce a character, and you only get a few lines of dialogue out of him before you kill him off is just shitty writing. It’s random and pointless.

Asside from the Anon/Russian leak, raising the bar, and the WC Map pack, what other sources are there?

The video footage of Half-Life 2 at E3 2003.

Read full topic
item.source: Hands up who REALLY wants the Cremator to appear in EP3.

item.title: Hands up who REALLY wants the Cremator to appear in EP3.
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
intooblivion:

Anyway that whole sequence of the original teleport scene is on my channel, you should watch it and educate yourself.

I’ve watched that before, and good lord it’s long-winded, wordy and dull. If it’s a good sample, then the one thing you can definitely say about the ‘beta storyline’ is that it was way overwritten, and Valve did a great job paring it down the minimalist awesomess that it eventually became.

Read full topic

item.description:
Yes, I’d love to see that thing. I pictured in my mind already how it could fit in. They’re in the Arctic, right? Well, it could be called something like the Icebreaker, using its plasma cannon to - what else? - melt ice. I think that sounds plausible.

item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
baconeggs:

So the ones deployed in City 17 were a bit friendly for you?

They don’t even do anything. They’re coded to shoot lasers at you, which they only do in episode 1, beyond that, they just stand around and make fart noises.

I like how in missing information, they’re fucking pissed.

the Borealis isnt really going to be in episode 3, there will be a borealis in episode 3 but theres not a chance valve is going to use very much if at all of the content within hl2b’s borealis

It’s the same ship, and also, the Borealis that’s going to appear in Ep. 3 will be The Borealis because it will actually be in the game and not some cut beta level.

item.title: Hands up who REALLY wants the Cremator to appear in EP3.
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
I never really thought of them (after reading raising the bar) to be enemies, but basically street cleaners, they show up after a fire-fight and get rid of any bodies. Just kind of NPCs you don’t want to mess with.

Like metro cops at the beginning of the game. Sure, you can induce them into beating the shit out of you, but why would you want to if it’s just going to slow you down? Also, yeah, I did it too, get them to chase you, then book it away from them and barely escape.

Read full topic
item.source: Hands up who REALLY wants the Cremator to appear in EP3.

item.title: Hands up who REALLY wants the Cremator to appear in EP3.
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
intooblivion:

stealing the earths resources and draining the oceans.
the rest of the resistance has to hold up in the farthest reaches of the world, the arctic, and is then assaulted by a huge combine army.
the citadel walls were literally eating the city consuming everything, much more so than in hl2.

These are still in the game, and how is it “much more so than in hl2?” You can tell that just from concept art? Do you not see the entire buildings being totaled by the walls or what?

intooblivion:

the absolutely merciless combine assassin

Alien overlords converting men into cyborg soldiers, but turning women into leather-clad cyborgs with thigh-high, high-heeled boots and skin-tight suits. Oh, that’s so dark and not hilariously stupid at all.

intooblivion:

The combine had a brutal propaganda campaign

Nothing says brutal like your alien overlords putting up even more [b]evil posters.[b]

intooblivion:

created arcade games for children which were actually just remote murdering devices

Actually, they always depicted adults controlling manhacks in the arcades, and the idea borrowed from the 1992 comedy “Toys” starring Robin Williams. Because we know he’s suck an evil mother-fucker.

intooblivion:

the stalkers were set loose on the city with their scythe like arms and laser eyes.

Instead of rebels being inslaved, crippled and hardly mobile, they are made into slaves, crippled and can run around like crack addicts, while wearing gimp masks and armed with metal claws. Because what good is a slave if they can’t stab shit?

intooblivion:

You fought huge synths from the 7 hour war

No, they were just from HL2, and were cut. Because they sucked.

intooblivion:

Breen found his way to immortality by being a head in a jar
the wastelands were filled with xenian creatures and portal storms
the half human half machine combine guard
the brutal combine elite with active camouflage

How exactly is this any of this shit darker? Sure it sounds neat, but it’s not dark.

intooblivion:

resistance was mopped up and the bodies were basically deleted

What the hell does this even mean?

intooblivion:

Alyx was brutally murdered by Breen towards the end of the game
kliener dies in the teleport mishap

Funny, none of the leak sound files indicate either of those were ever planned at any point.

intooblivion:

The combine were replacing the air with unbreathable gasses
children were set to work in slave factories bulding cremators and other killing machines

Child labor is the darkest thing that was cut from the game. But damn if it isn’t fun to watch.

ADDITIONAL BONUS STUPID :
the borealis carrys pods containing the female assassins, because for some reason they’re not made the same way as regular soldiers, and need to be kept floating in vats of goo.
If only a wall of text could kill.
A large chasm with a catwalk over it, where people work as stenographer’s all day. The evil alien overlords need people to type for them, or make them do it just to be dicks.
I love when people don’t reply. It makes me feel like I’ve won.
A building designed to suck the water and atmosphere out of the earth. (Weather Control)
A separate building, miles away that pumps a new atmosphere into the earth. (Air Exchange)

Read full topic
item.source: Hands up who REALLY wants the Cremator to appear in EP3.

item.title: Hands up who REALLY wants the Cremator to appear in EP3.
item.dc:creator: intooblivion
item.description:
You fail dias.

The original storyline was much darker in story, not just luminescence.

The combine had a brutal propaganda campaign, created arcade games for children which were actually just remote murdering devices, children were set to work in slave factories bulding cremators and other killing machines, and the citadel walls were literally eating the city consuming everything, much more so than in hl2.

The combine were replacing the air with unbreathable gasses, stealing the earths resources and draining the oceans.

Breen found his way to immortality by being a head in a jar, Alyx was brutally murdered by Breen towards the end of the game, the wastelands were filled with xenian creatures and portal storms, resistance was mopped up and the bodies were basically deleted, and the stalkers were set loose on the city with their scythe like arms and laser eyes.

You fought huge synths from the 7 hour war, the half human half machine combine guard, the absolutely merciless combine assassin, the brutal combine elite with active camouflage, kliener dies in the teleport mishap, the rest of the resistance has to hole up in the farthest reaches of the world, the arctic, and is then assaulted by a huge combine army.

And that’s just part of it.

EDIT: The only elements which were silly were maybe the manhack arcades and the breen in a jar.

Read full topic
item.source: Hands up who REALLY wants the Cremator to appear in EP3.
